rules.natural: If the region plants native species, then it establishes wildlife habitat.
In the case that the region plants native species, it does not improve soil quality.
Whenever biodiversity increases in the region, soil quality improves.
Provided that the region uses organic methods, it achieves sustainability goals.
If the region adopts sustainable practices, then it uses organic methods.
Provided that the region requires certification, it either imports chemical pesticides or adopts sustainable practices.
The region produces organic crops or produces conventional crops.
If the region passes the environmental law, then having funding for the conservation program leads to achieving sustainability goals.
Under the condition that the region produces conventional crops, it achieves sustainability goals.
Whenever the region meets export standards, it achieves sustainability goals.
If the region passes quality inspection, then it does not fail quality inspection.
Provided that the region experiences crop failure, it has soil erosion.
In the case that the region faces economic loss, it experiences crop failure.
Assuming the region applies for government aid, it faces economic loss.
Whenever the region receives disaster relief, it applies for government aid.
If the region mandates reforestation, then either it reforests the protected area or lacks timber in the protected forest.
Under the condition that the region implements the conservation plan, it monitors ecosystem health.
Whenever the region reports environmental data, planting native species improves soil quality.
If the region trains conservation staff, then monitoring ecosystem health ensures that environmental data is reported.
The region trains conservation staff or hires an environmental expert.
In the case that the region clears forest land, it degrades soil quality.
The region clears forest land or burns vegetation.
Whenever the region burns vegetation, it does not have timber in the protected forest.
Under the condition that the region applies for the funding program, it receives financial support.
In the case that the region receives financial support, it qualifies for the conservation grant.

rules.prover9_expression: (grows(region, invasive_species) | (-(has_job(region, agricultural_inspector) | (-passes(region, environmental_law) -> violates(region, environmental_law))) -> -lacks_job(region, agricultural_inspector)))
rules.natural: The region grows invasive species or, if it is not the case that it has the job of agricultural inspector or (not passing the environmental law implies violation), then it does not lack the job of agricultural inspector.
Assuming the region bans invasive species, it does not grow invasive species.
If it is not the case that establishing wildlife habitat leads to increased biodiversity, then biodiversity decreases.
Provided that it is not true that establishing wildlife habitat implies increased biodiversity, biodiversity does not decrease.
Under the condition that producing organic crops does not entail meeting export standards, the region fails quality inspection.
In the case that producing organic crops does not result in meeting export standards, the region passes quality inspection.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(hires(region, environmental_expert) -> (monitors(region, ecosystem_health) -> reports(region, environmental_data))) -> develops(region, training_program))
rules.natural: Whenever hiring an environmental expert does not guarantee that monitoring ecosystem health results in reported environmental data, the region develops a training program.
Provided that developing a training program does not imply lacking technical expertise, the region maintains an expertise gap.
In the case that developing a training program does not lead to lacking technical expertise, it is not true that the region maintains an expertise gap.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(has_job(region, agricultural_inspector) | (-passes(region, environmental_law) -> violates(region, environmental_law))) -> lacks_job(region, agricultural_inspector))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that the region has the job of agricultural inspector or (not passing the environmental law implies violation), then the region lacks the job of agricultural inspector.
Whenever degrading soil quality does not imply lacking timber in the protected forest, it is not the case that the region preserves soil quality.
If it is not true that the region harvests the protected forest or lacks timber in the protected forest, then it plants native species.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(degrades(region, soil_quality) -> -has_timber(region, protected_forest)) -> preserves(region, soil_quality)) -> applies(region, funding_program))
rules.natural: In the case that it is not true that (not degrading soil quality implying lacking timber) results in preserved soil quality, the region applies for the funding program.
Assuming that it is not the case that (not degrading soil quality implying lacking timber) entails preserved soil quality, the region does not qualify for the conservation grant.
Whenever the region does not achieve sustainability goals, it receives disaster relief.
Provided that the region does not achieve sustainability goals, it has timber in the protected forest.
